org.apache.poi.sl.draw

Class DrawFontManagerDefault

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.poi.sl.draw.DrawFontManagerDefault
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DrawFontManager 

    public class DrawFontManagerDefault
extends java.lang.Object
implements DrawFontManager
    Manages fonts when rendering slides. Use this class to handle unknown / missing fonts or to substitute fonts(${t_95fca40ec07c4619b62d71c100d5615d})

      • mapFontCharset

        public java.lang.String mapFontCharset(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics,
                                       FontInfo fontInfo,
                                       java.lang.String text)
        Symbol fonts like "Wingdings" or "Symbol" have glyphs mapped to a Unicode private use range via the Java font loader, although a system font viewer might show you the glyphs in the ASCII range. This maps the chars of the text string to the corresponding private use range chars.(${t_4a8ec2b1ccd846a6b0cbfa5eb204eb3a})
        Specified by:
        mapFontCharset in interface DrawFontManager(${t_3a46cd24b23449f4a1b56c432b835c63})
        Parameters:
        graphics - the used graphics context(${t_796b13bf4716418dae3d0017ab966142})
        fontInfo - the font info(${t_89e0d3789c2844feb20eb0a8bca253f3})
        text - the input string(${t_4120645848714ca185dca8e813b951db})
        Returns:
        the mapped string, typically consists of chars in the range of 0xf000 to 0xf0ff(${t_8aa40689793141cdb52d7f5f9456cdbb})
        Since:
        POI 4.0.0
        See Also:
        Drawing exotic fonts in a java applet, StringUtil.mapMsCodepointString(String)

        fontSize - the font size in points(${t_bb423f3d659c492fabd4681dcf041e7a})
        bold - true if the font is bold(${t_f05e678f0ffb42d4b0d4080b217e195f})
